40216376.review:
Beklentimin üstünde muazzam bir oyun. Basit ama rahat oynanabilirlik ve minik hikayeleri şekillendirerek asıl sona ulaşmaya çalıştığımız sağlam tasarlanmış harika ötesi bir oyun. Öve öve bitirmek istemiyorum ama oyunda Friendly Fire gibi gıcık bir şey yüzünden bazı görevlerde habire sakatlık yaşadığım için normal bir şekilde anlatacağım. :D 

[h1]Asıl konumuz;[/h1]Karakterimiz Gunslinger'ın bir gün bizon çiftliğinde abisine yardım ederken bizonun teki vahşileşip çitleri aşarak kaçması ve minik kovalama ardından akşam vakti eve dönmesiyle, ailesinin katledildiği gördüğü acı gerçekleşe yüzleşerek katilini arama serüveni. Elimizde ki tek ipucu katilin bir şapka taktığı ve bu ipucunu sürmeye başlıyoruz. Aslında ipucu sürdüğümüz yok tam olarak. İnsanlara yardım ediyoruz ve onlar da bize şüpheli kişi hakkında bilgi vererek yapbozu tamamlıyoruz. Tamamladığımızda da ona benzeye kişiyi şehirlerde arıyor ve yüzleşiyor. Bu kişi her oyuna başladığınızda rastgele biri olacağı için rastgele insanları öldürmek oyunu bitirmenizi sağlamıyor. Etrafı delik deşik edip herkesi öldürürseniz bir noktadan sonra yapımcı oyuna el atıyor ve bişi öldürmek için bir sürü düşman yolluyor, bir sonu var mı bilmiyorum ama ben denediğimde kaybettim bir noktadan sonra. :D 
Olayımız asıl hikaye olduğu kadar minik hikayelerde. Bir sürü minik hikaye donatılmış ve her hikaye bize bir ipucu verecek şekilde ilerliyor. Bazı hikayeler farklı şekilde bitebiliyor. Mesela bir şerifle olan silah arkadaşlığınız, ondaki kovboyluk ateşi sönmüş olduğu için onu aldatmayı düşünen karsı hakkında fikirlerini değiştirmenizi sağlıyor, hatta kendi karınız bile yapabiliyorsunuz, olmadı başkasına kaçıyor veya da şerifle silahlı maceralar sonrası karısı mutlu bir biçimde bize teşekkür edip para hediye ediyor. Buna benzer çiftlik sahipleri ve petrol zengini adam arasında çatışmalar, bankacı ve haydutlar, kızılderililer ve askerler gibi taraf seçmek veya barışçıl çözüm aramak ya da tamamen uzak durarak ailenizin katilinin ipuçlarını farklı şekilde sürmeye çalışıyorsunuz. 

[h1]Ayrıyeten;[/h1]Daha da minik görev olarak birbirlerini arayan meksikalı kankalar, altın bufalonun parçalarını aradığımız altın toplar, şapkacı kadın için şapka toplamak, hayalet madenci gibi minik yan etkinliklerde mevcut. Küçük haritasına rağmen bir hayli şey sığdırılmış dolu dolu bir oyun bu. Ayrıyeten oyun içinde yapacağınız şeyler size yeni karakterler açarak farklı bir deneyim almanızı sağlabilir. Arada bir kaç tane de espri şeysileri var oyunda ama asıl keyifli olan iki şey ise insanları silahla korkutarak tepkilerini ölçmek, kimi zaman fikir değiştirmelerini sağlıyor, diğeri ise aranıyor posterlerinde ki haydutları yakalamak. Aranıyor posterinde ki kişiyi, en son görüldüğü yerde, ona benzeyen kişiyi bulmak keyifli bir dedektifçilik oynama hissi veriyor. Bazen öldürüyor, bazense şapkasından vurarak etkisiz hale getirip canlı ele geçiriyoruz.

[h1]Oynanış mekanikleri ise basit.[/h1] Yöne tuşları, silah çekme ve tetikleme tuşları dışında sürekli güncellenen günlüğümüz var. Sadece sağ ve sol doğrultuda ateş edebilsekte bu kısa süreli oyun için keyif verici bir oynanış mekaniği, böylelikle düşmanları öldürüyor veya da şapkalarından vurarak onları etkisiz hale getiriyoruz, tabi herkes için işlemiyor bu ama şapkalarını toplayarak can elde edebiliyoruz. Bildiğim kadarıyla altı patlar, çift altı patlar, pompalı tüfek, nişancı tüfeği, bola olmak üzere yeterli silah çeşitliliği var ama ben bazı silahları açmamış olabilirim, nette araştırdığımda balta da olduğunu gördüm.

[h1]Görsel tasarım olarak;[/h1] Atmosfer bakımından doğa tasarımı çok hoşuma gitti. Bir sürü hayvan var doğada, kimisi saldırgan kimisi tarafsız şekilde etrafta sürekli dolanıyorlar, bomboş hissettirmiyor harita. Çöl kısımları hariç müziklerin geneli de çok güzel oturmuş arka plana, genel olarak temasını gayet başarılı yansıtıyor piksel görüntü kalitesinde. Ayrıyeten belirtmek isterim ki orman bölgesine girdiğiniz de çalan müzik "Forest Theme" çok hoşuma gitti ve size de öneririm dinlemenizi. 

Son olarak söylemeliyim ki ahım şahım bir şeyler sunmasa da kendi içindeki şeyi çok başarılı tasarlamış ve aktarmış bir oyun olarak son derece öneriyorum oynamanızı. Puanın bir kısmını Friendly Fire'dan, bir kısmını da bazı görevler arada bir bug'a girdiğinden kırdım, puanım 85/100, gölgenizden hızlı silah çekmeniz dileğiyle oyuncular. YEEEHAAAW!

40013836.review:
A 2D top-down action shooter adventure in the Wild West. Decent story with several endings based on certain questline completions/actions. There is a bit of replayability because of the 3 unlockable characters and a few incompatible questlines. Combat is only done horizontally; you (and your opponents) can only shoot left/right. It means that you do a lot of up/down dodging and jostling for position.

It took me a few tries to get into it because I didn't like certain aspects of the game. When you die you lose half your money and until you finish the game you won't know how important money is. I restarted/stopped playing after a death because I didn't know how the game worked. Money is not a limited resource: you can earn money by grinding "Wanted" posters, collecting them on the ground, doing a certain bull quest, or as a reward for other quests. Money is used to purchase hats (you store up to 3 hats for 3 lives), weapons (you hold up to 3), clothing (just visual), and (the big thing) certain quests.

Also, I didn't like that it uses an autosave system (no manual saving). I would have greatly preferred to have free control over saves, using save slots for key moments and to see how choices mattered without replaying the whole game over again each time. Eventually I found out that you can manually 'save scum' using the actual save files but it's an extra hassle the devs wanted for some reason.

The world is a bit overwhelming at first because it's an open world and you're directionless but after you've played the game you know where things are and where the quest givers/targets are and the world is smaller than it seems. Most of the civilians walking around town only say flavor text and there are a limited amount of important locations (the rest is travel filler/scenery with angry bandits/money/quest collectibles).

It's worth a look if you like horizontal shooters and doing an adventure (doing quests with the goal of finding your family's murderer) set in the Wild West.

Other thoughts:[list]
[*] This is an (apparently greatly) expanded and polished version of the free game you can play on Adult Swim's website. It's worth looking at that as a demo to see if you'd be interested in this.
[*] It's a little annoying that 'bandits' who try to shoot you on sight when you get close are apparently counted as civilians and count towards one of the endings. You're only 'allowed' to shoot those on wanted posters.
[*] It's nice that there are multiple endings.
[*] Scorpions and angry dogs are the real scourge of the Wild West. I've had followers randomly die to them while I was just trying to get to the next screen. Humans who have to pause an aim don't hold a candle to them.
[*] Bullets pierce and travel off-screen. This means you need to force your target to the edge of the screen and fire towards the edge if you don't want to randomly kill a bystander.
[/list]

39326487.review:
Westerado is a fun, clever, well-programmed bit of Western flavoured adventuring. In fact, I really enjoyed it on a number of levels, given that despite the fact that the goal you're given is straightforward enough - Avenge your family by finding your murder, the process of getting there is pretty complex. This is for a number of reasons- but the biggest one is that the storyline is branching, with a handful of endings for the player to find all based on the decisions they take to find out the identity of their murder. Certain requests you get from townspeople that might give you a clue are mutually exclusive, leading to entirely different outcomes, and the game has systems in place to take into account all of these things. It's honestly pretty fantastic. 

That, and there's just a lot of weird sidequests you can do, for fun, and the precious cash you'll need to finish other quests, get guns, and play dressup with different outfits.

Combat itself can be a bit tricky to get used to, since you need to aim and cock your weapon before you fire- and the fast movement you'll need to move out of the way of enemies (Who also function by these same rules), will throw off your aim. It makes it challenging in an enjoyable way, however- and the game's forgiving enough to give you a grand total of 4 hits you can soak (3 'hats' which somehow absorb bullets), before you reach critical mass - and which can be replenished by shooting off the hats of enemies.

Tl;DR. I will happily recommend this game.

39322609.review:
Westerado is adorable, surprisingly deep and fully featured, and heaps of fun to play. I think it's popularity has been hampered by the $15 price mark and the 3 hour playtime. Don't be fooled. This is a game that was made to be played more than once. The soundtrack and pixel art are fantastic and the sheer amount of content crammed into this little title is enough to make big studio open world games blush. I highly recommend it and I hope that Ostritch Banditos take their heads out of the sand to give us some more indie greatness some day.

Check out my full review here: https://findingpants.com/2018/01/03/westerado/

39177867.review:
This is an awesome, proper old school open world game, which, even with proper old school graphics, creates a really immersive wild west environment.

The game is about finding the man who burned your farm down by getting clues from various people in return for favours. But you can kill anyone. Absolutely anyone. Even in the middle of a conversation with them. Even if they might be able to give you a clue...

The combat is simple but surprisingly satisfying once you have it down, and there are different weapons and outfits and other stuff to buy with money found lying around or on enemies.

The music is awesome too. It really draws you into the whole classic wild west scenario and is enjoyable in itself.

The graphics are what they are, but they add to the beautiful simplicity of the game.

A great game, and I would recommend it to anyone who wants something a bit different from the open world genre.

39155088.review: A brilliant little gem with intuitive controls and an engaging and surprising storyline. The world is alive and beautiful, emphasis on the beautiful. The music is stellar and the mechanics slick and easy to use. It's a shame there isn't a workshop for more quests, weapons etc as there isn't a lot of content. On it's own though, Westerado is a must for anyone wanting an immersive and light hearted wild west adventure with the classic dark themes of Clint Eastwood's days.

Westerado: Double Barreled《西部正义：双管猎枪》

说实话，这游戏，要不是我玩了网上的版本，或许我根本就不知道这款游戏，因为他的真的是太不出名了。甚至查
Ostrich Banditos（开发商）也只找到了这游戏的小官网（http://www.ostrichbanditos.com/）当然里面还有FB和推特。
在国内知道这游戏的人，肯定是很少的了，百度上的资料也是寥寥无几，更不用说贴吧了。

（一）像素类风格的游戏
          一直是我比较喜欢。虽然他的制作成本低，但这让一个小公司小作坊有自己的想法和创意可以加以改造。
          这也是为什么我喜欢玩低像素的游戏因为我总能找到他们与其他游戏不一样的想法与惊喜。
          （挣扎吧,在血和暗的深渊里;痛苦吧）DS3.jpg

（二）开放世界和自由度
         现在游戏都会以开放世界，自由探索为特点，这游戏也不例外，其开放世界和自由度让我特别的惊讶，
         这根本不像是一个小作坊做出来的。我甚至为此感到惊讶，因为玩家可以做出很多决定【你可以二话不说，把自己的叔叔杀
         死，不管是在谈话中还是路过，你都可以拔出你的枪伸张正义（无恶不作）】
         PS：（多结局）

（三）剧情
          Brother和妈妈被杀，然后找凶手。
          通过任务和对话寻找凶手特征然后一步一步找出真凶略有侦探感觉，游戏中没有特别的任务提示，完全就是自由探索。
          你可以先去做这个任务，也可以干脆不做。怎么样一切随你，你就是主角。
          （nothing is true,everything is permitted）

（四）音乐
          FUCK ME FUCK ME.这音乐是真的TM好听+终极洗脑，就算我很久不玩，只要给我一段，我就给你全哼出来。
          音乐超有西部风格
         （也很刚死全家的感觉）

  最后

  网上有体验版免费游玩。但版本和现在版本不一样，有很大不同。
  http://www.u77.com/game/8563（U77的西部正义有汉化）
  http://www.mhhf.com/gamep-3414（灵动的西部正义有汉化）
  
  两个都是旧版本，我发出这两个主要是让大家先体验一下，毕竟这游戏真是太不知名了
 如果可以请购买正版游玩，而且新版本有许多许多许多许多许多的梗和有趣的东西(有趣).jpg


 最后的最后
 
 STEAM版没有汉化。没有汉化。
 但是！
 请大家不要因为没有汉化而放弃这款游戏，这是一部优秀的电影也是优秀的游戏。
 GOOD GAME

38664111.review:
Westerado is a great 2D action shooter. The gameplay is simple and is relatively easy to get use to. I did play this on gamepad rather than keyboard. I would highly recommend your first playthrough of the game is played with the music on. The music was incredible reminded me of the spaghetti western films. You'll notice little tidbits/nods to cowboy films and characters. The dialogue from characters is often pretty well written. They even added a nice little feature where you aren't locked into dialogue. You can simply walk away from the conversation and carry on.

If you get into the game you'll find that you'll play it multiple times for different storylines. Not all missions can be completed in one play through. The game can bug out at times because of this. This can also feel a bit grindy and you'll end up skipping dialogue you've read several times.

It's good for about 10-15hrs of gameplay and you can pick up and play at any time.

38127023.review:
Westerado: Double Barreled is an open world set in western times, released in April 2015. You take on the role of a gunslinger who is tasked with hunting down his families killer. 

The way in which you complete this task differs from other games in my view; you have to find clues about the identity of the culprit by completing missions and objectives for locals around the towns. This really adds to the mystery behind the killer. Even the options menu has a screen dedicated to showing you all the clues you have found along with a model of a character showing the clues on, such as a "fat, blue shirt, medium sized hat" figure for example. These clues are all randomly generated each playthrough as well. 

Another really new feature in Westerado is the that you can draw your gun at anytime, even during a conversion with any NPC, this can sometimes trigger a different set of dialogue, initiate a new quest, or just go completely wrong and end up in a gun fight. This also means you can kill anyone in the story too, no matter how important they are to the plot, anyone can die.

The main gameplay is a top down action game, in good old western style, you have your gun which you have to manually reload every six shots, or you can upgrade it to a big ol shotgun. The gunfights can sometimes feel a little bit clunky, but once you get used to the controls and how the game responds to them, it soon becomes clear and easily executed. Another one of my favorite parts of the game would be the buffalo scenes; riding horse back defending carriages from bandits on a buffalo's, although simple, it is really compelling to play.

Westerado has a very clever story, and has all the main plot points that any good western film will have in it. Although you can make the story different each time you play, for instance just killing one of the main quest givers, I am not sure it actually changes the whole outcome of the game, I think all that will happen is you'll just miss out on those quests rather it have an effect on the grand scheme of things. 

The world in which you play in is huge, it's set out like a very Zelda style map, each tile on the map has four entry points, north, west, south and east. This makes navigating across the map very easy and you can always make your way to where you need to be very quickly. Each of the zones look amazing too; lots of detail has gone into adding plenty of objects, background items and scenery to add to the western feel. Although the graphics are the ever growing popular, pixelated style, it still has a really nice look to it. 

Length wise, Westerado can be over and done with in less than an hour if you just do the main story, which is actually what I did on my first playthrough. However it is highly recommended that you don't just do that, as you are missing out on tons of content in the side missions, along with loads of story too. There is so much to see in Westerado if you just take the time to explore.

37723531.review: A spaghetti western. The aesthetics are immersive. The landscape is appeasing to behold, and the soundtrack is enjoyable. The mechanics are simple and convenient. Just a handful of keys on the keyboard, and they can be remapped. Death is a setback, not a game-ender, so you're encouraged to explore choices and consequences. Want to pull your gun on someone in a conversation? You can! \o/ Want to anger an entire town by getting into a saloon fight? You can! \o/ How about rob a bank? Yep. Kill an oil tycoon and create a new franchise? Uh huh. Hurl dozens of tomahawks at hostile folk whose only defense is a hat? You got it! There's a sandbox quality to exploring the land, but the way to end the game is by completing your Quest for Vengeance. Who is your target? Well, that's randomly generated, and you've got to find clues. Or, I reckon you could gun down everyone. If you can't have nice things, then neither should they.

37452799.review:
For a simple title with not much meat to the gameplay (walk around to line up with the enemy, click, bang) Westerado compensates by making the dialogue system amusingly interactive (in the ammended words of Todd Howard: [h1][i]"You see that discussion? You can whip out your revolver and threaten them."[/i][/h1]) and features a number of branching quests that'll culminate in different sub-endings while pointing you in the direction for your final showdown against the killer. Each time the journey can greatly differ, as does the appearance of the varmint that gunned your family down, but the destination ulimately remains the same.

A playthrough of Westerado can last anywhere from a mere 5 minutes (when you've been through vengenace limbo more than a few times) to a fistful of magical hours discovering everything during your first run in this whodunnit 'em up, plenty of replayability exists on top of this to chalk up a few hours more finding everything you've missed or irreparably accidentally'd (which WILL likely happen sooner or later).

A definite reccomendation for those looking for a charming little 2D western oozing freedom and can tolerate something a bit more basic, some words of caution over how repetitive it can get after the magic fades (just like Todd Howard's game, all of 'em).

Spiel:

getötet.

Mörder nicht sehen, nun muss man Nebenquest 
auf der komplett frei begehbaren Karte erledigen 
um Informationen über den Mörder zu erhalten.

Man kann selbst seine Weg wählen in dem Spiel, 
alles wirkt sich auf etwas aus. Wenn man jemanden 
das falsche sagt oder man jemanden tötet kann 
es sich auf Quest und den weiter Spielverlauf auswirken.

Die Quest sind einfach gestrickt töte Banditen, 
löse Konflikte, bringe einen Gegenstand

gewünscht.

------------------------------------------------------

sehr zur jeweiligen Situation. Hier steckt wirklich

------------------------------------------------------

Die Steuerung mit dem XBOX 360 Pad war einfach 
super.

------------------------------------------------------


Pro/Contra:

+ Super schön inszeniert 
+ Super Musik

+ Entscheidungsfreiheit

- sehr schweres Englisch
- keine Coop mit Gamepad und Tastatur

Ein wirklich cooles kurzes Game, was man sicherlich

anders machen können. Leider gibt es keine 
Deutsche Übersetzung von dem Spiel und geplant 
ist auch keine was wirklich schade ist. 

Das Englisch was hier geschrieben wird ist kein

Wer es dennoch probieren will, es ist ein Super

Ich hoffe das es noch einen zweiten Teil geben

14,99€ finde ich etwas zu teuer für dieses sehr

Mehrspieler: 5/10
Grafik: 8/10

36860700.review:
The Far West is closer than ever before.

Objectively speaking, Westerado: Double Barreled is not the most realistic western game out there; yet it somehow manages to convey the sense of lawlessness and romanticism of the Old West better than any other. Sure, Red Dead Redemption or Call of Juarez show vibrant 3D worlds packed with action, but I did not miss any of it while playing the game of Ostrich Bandidos.

The first thing that struck me was how easy and immediate is to simply draw the gun and kill an NPC; the second was to realize that this often leads to an irreversible loss of an optional quest. It may bother some, but this is freedom in its purest form: you can do virtually anything withing the constraints of the gameplay, as long as you accept that those actions will have consequences. And these are not necessarily bad, since it is always possible to reach the end of the game -- only completionists will have to be extra careful not to skip any secondary quest.

And the rest... you should see for yourself. Don´t be put off by the retro graphics, which look surprisingly ok after the first half hour, or by the limited range of options. Instead, play this game for the unique feelings that it conveys in its modest visual style.

36605811.review:
Weak recommendation.

Westerado is a unique spin on a whodunnit style of game with a lot of violence and not a lot of restrictions on the player.  Unfortunately it's also pretty repetitive and not so much a mystery you're solving as collecting exact descriptions of a perp by doing awkward sidequests that are easy to kill out of being completable.  Features a lot of corny western movie jokes, unlockable characters and an okay co-op.  The combat is very easily exploitable, but you do have access to a variety of weapons and hat-shotting is satisfying and useful.  There's also the occasional minigame that's functional but nothing too exciting.

Basically once you get tired of shooting people at the most ridiculous times you can find you'll probably need to restart to finish the main quest and whatever other sidequests you wish.  This won't take especially long, and the other modes are just more of the same- and 2 player isn't good enough to warrant the purchase just for that.  There's nothing quite like Westerado and it's very fun for the first bit, but it has little staying power and it's fairly pricey for the length.

36563045.review:
Westerado is an old spahgetti western game with a robust world that has plenty in it to keep you entertained. Simple gameplay and giving the player the power to go through the game leisurely make for a fun time. I went in not expecting much and the game got hooked for the entire playthrough.

Soundtrack
When it comes to sound design all I ask of games like this, is to go with what's happening on screen and set an appropriate tone. Westerado does this and then goes further. Making enjoyable sounding music to accompany the game throughout. Although all talk is text they do get the sound effects on point to balance it out. Thanks to the sounds shootin' yer guns feels satisfying as ever.

Gameplay
The gameplay as stated before is quite simple and yet it is so effective at inducing fun. You have a large 'open' world with plenty of places to visit and even tasks that you must complete to get to some of them. Or you can choose to ignore it all and follow you're main objective which is not related to any of it. Your main objective is figuring out who murdered your family and burned down your ranch. The game leaves that person up to RNG. It's a guess who approach. The murderser's appearance is randomized and you must complete quests or speak with certain people to gain small clues as to who it was. It can be done quickly or it can be done as you please. Either way after a short tutorial what you decide to do before you find your man can result in very different endings. The variation is surprising here and well done. Combat is a highlight. You can move, run, draw your gun, and shoot. The shooting requires you to line up your gun horizontally with an enemy onscreen. And it can be hectic at times but once you get the hang of it you'll likely have no troubles. One of the best parts is you can walk up to anyone and perform any of these actions on them as well. It's funny you have the power to interrupt anyones dialog by drawing your gun. I really enjoyed this freedom. More games need this kind of approach.

Story
The story is about revenge, love, greed, and guns. That is if you're counting the sidequests. Becasue the main story is as simple as previously described. You can engage with all of it or none of it. Someone take away your home and family from you and you seek revenge. There really isn't much more to say. 

Graphics
The pixel art is fantastic and it was a great choice for this game. Made for some really great moods in certain locations and fits with the rest of the game's simplicity. 

I would recommend this easily. I thought it was just one of those games to play when you're up for wasting time but I was pleasently surprised by what this game had to offer. Pick it up, it's a fair price and delivers lots of fun and variation.

7/10

36505350.review:
I've never written a review for any game before, but I feel like I have to say something about Westerado. It's one of the best indie games I've played in a while, and even though I got it in a bundle, I'd say it's worth it at full price. From the moment I started Westerado up, I was hooked.

The story deals with you figuring out who murdered your family and burned down your ranch. The murderer's appearance is randomized every time, and each game, you complete quests to get clues as to his appearance. You can do this fairly quickly; it only took me a couple hours to beat my first playthrough. 

What really sets the game apart, though, is how replayable this simple premise is. The complexity is in how the world reacts to you. It's got a quasi-open world map, in which you can go anywhere on the map and talk to and shoot anyone at any time. This can actually lock off certain endings and quests, and doing certain questlines also locks off other questlines, making it impossible to see everything the game has in one playthrough.

The gameplay is simple but extremely satisfying. You can move, run, draw your gun, and shoot. The shooting is fairly simple; it only requires you to line up your gun horizontally with an enemy onscreen. However, the gunplay is immensely satisfying, due to the simple controls and the outstanding sound effects. I really can't stress enough how good it feels to play this game. I've only playing using a keyboard, but a controller should work just fine as well, since there's only a few buttons needed aside from movement.

Westerado also really nails the western movie aesthetic; the world they've created, the interactions you have with it, and the characters within it feel lifted out of a movie, and there are actually a few fourth-wall breaking moments that allude to this fact.

If you're looking for something unique to play, don't pass Westerado up. It may seem simple on the surface, but it won't leave you disappointed.

Great game but you can complete it in about 1-3 hours so wait for a sale.  This game is a retro-style isometric-2d game where you play as a gunslinger in the west looking for your family's killer.  It has some pretty cool mechanics such as pulling out your gun first, cocking it, then being able to fire  which allows you to sometimes bluff someone into not fighting or giving you info and you can do this in dialogue options as well.  So, you run around helping people to find out clues about the killer and you will find out tidbits about what he is wearing (pants, hat, shirt, etc).  Once you have all of your information, you can look for him in the towns and train stations to find him, chase him, and kill him.  There are a lot of side quests, the combat is simple but fun, and there is a good amount of humor referencing hats and the western/southern accent (I is always pronounced "Ah" with the main character, as in "Ah'll see what Ah can do.")  The game is also fun to rivisit from time to time since it is such a short playthrough, but depending on how you play different things can happen plus the killer is always randomized.

Great game, very short, feel free to get it on a sale.  Heck, with Steams refund policy, you have a good chance of playing, beating it, and refunding it...although I would encourage you to keep it since it is a good game.

35731546.review:
[b]Kleines, feines Open World Spiel, welches einem die Chance gibt, im Rahmen der Möglichkeiten, seine eigene Westerngeschichte zu erleben.[/b]

Aber zurück auf Anfang:

Ein mysteriöser Desperado tötet Deine Familie und Du beginnst ihn zu jagen. Wo und wie Du die Fährte aufnimmst, bleibt Dir selber überlassen. Fast jeder erfüllte Auftrag in der Spielwelt bringt Dich dem Desperado näher, in Form von Hinweisen auf sein Aussehen. 
Hilfst Du den Bahnbetreibern, den Zugverkehr wieder aufzunehmen? Sicherst Du Geldtransporte für die Bank? Zettelst Du einen Krieg zwischen der US Army und einem ansässigen Ureinwohnerstamm an und entscheidest Dich für eine Seite? Du kannst auch einfach alle Passnten erschießen und hoffen, dass Du den richtige triffst.
Der Desperado wird bei jedem Neustart der Geschichte neu ausgewürfelt und Du hast neue Möglichkeiten, Deinen eigenen Western zu schreiben. Ein hoher Wiederspielwert ist also garantiert.

Die Grafik ist definitiv Ansichtssache. Der etwas grob wirkende Pixellook ist bestimmt nicht jedermanns Sache. Auch ist die Schießmechanik im ersten Moment Gewöhnungsbedürftig. Jede Kugel muss, mit gezückter Waffe, nachgeladen werden. 
Aber wenn man sich darauf einlässt, kann man eine kleine, nette Westernwelt für sich entdecken.

35730791.review: Cara sem dúvida é o melhor jogo do adult swin, possue de tudo:Coop,historia boa,escolha de dialogos,várias quests,mundo grande e detalhado.   AS MECANICAS:  este jogo é do genero crawler não sendo um rpg é claro e suas vidas no game são medidas por chapéus, cada vez que você toma um hit você perde um chapéu se você ficar sem nenhum você morre,como sendo do genêro Crawler você enfrenta os inimigos por meios de cenários pequenos lembrando fallout 1,está mecanica faz que o jogo não tenha loadings exceto se você viajar de cavalo,tambem o cenário fica mais bem trabalhado por cada cenário ser realizado indívidualmente.A HISTORIA: No jogo de navegador free o jogo é um filme é cada vez que você morre é avaliado por seus feitos como se fosse a nota do filme de uma estrela a cinco estrelas,no Double Barreled a hístoria é completamente diferente até possuindo cameras escondidas como easter eggs,no entanto você no jogo é o filho mais novo de um fazendeiro  que é morto em um incêndio que mata toda sua familia, comsumido pelo ódio você caça o assasino da sua familia realizando quests,e a cada quest você vai ganhando caracteristicas do bandido:chapéu grande,cachecol etc.E cada vez que você zera o game o bandido muda de aparencìa ajudando no fator replay.               10/10

[h1]Western, Pixel Graphics and Rich Story-Telling[/h1]

It's an Open-world, Western that felt JUST like "Westworld",
You're given Quests from NPCs and in doing certain Quests, you will be locked out from doing other Quests, as they intertwine.

This means it has a very high replayability if you're interested in the Opposing factions storylines,
There's 7 endings which don't often feel like you're replaying the entire game from scratch as you're taking a different route each time, and things change.

I saw this game on Steam all the time but never thought it to be a game I'd enjoy,
The Trailer for it makes it seem like you just investigate "who did it" throughout the town for the entirity of the game,
but I feel that's more of a side-quest, and you eventually find out "who did it" while running around the Western World and doing the odd jobs for some Farmers or Miners.

35409879.review:
It's simple to learn how to play, but challenging to be good at it.

It has a good story that branches out into different paths, some that take you one way, others another. 

Different weapons have different characteristics and aiming. 

Lots of replay value as you try to get different endings. 

Different characters you unlock have different characteristics, like death after one hit for those that like a challenge.

Music is pretty nice and doesn't really get annoying (unless you stay on one map for hours playing Blackjack).

You could kill anyone in the game and even get a reward for doing so.

Lots of quests to do. Bounty hunting and Blackjack are profitable means of gaining money.

The boss fight can be a pain in the ass though. Go prepared, cheese the fight, enjoy the game before that point because the ending is the literal end. 

No manual saves, only autosaves. 

Fully recommend the game. Great fun, great story.

35194025.review:
You play the son of a rancher, who upon returning to your family ranch find it burned to the ground and both your parents murdered by an unknown assailant. 

And that is the objective of the game. To find the killer and bring him to justice. You go around an open world completeing little jobs or missions for people in exchange for items or sometimes clues. The game is not linear and it is up to you how you want to go about completing the game. 

The game is published by Adult Swim, but don't let that put you off. I'm sure many other people who are older (30+) see Adult Swim and automatically think obnoxious and immature game, like their shows, but that is not the case here. The game doesn't take itself TOO seriously, but the little humor it does have isn't over the top stupid like you'd expect from Adult Swim. 

The controls themselves are good, and the interface works well. The only down side, and I guess this is a big one, is the combat. All shooting is done left and right. Don't get me wrong, this doesn't ruin the game, it just makes fire fights feel a little less meaningful. 

One of the cool parts of the game, aside from the fact you can talk to every single NPC in the game, is that during conversations you can literally point yout gun at the person your talking to's face. Sometimes that will make them stop talking to you. Sometimes it will make them run. Sometimes it will make them attack. Sometimes it will make them give you their money because they think you're robbing them. And sometimes they will give you a clue about the killer. 

The game itself isn't very long, about 4 hours. However, there is infinite replayability in the sense that every time you start a new game, it's a brand new killer. So if you bought the game and enjoyed it, you shouldn't feel dread whern you complete the storyline, because you can just do it all over again and huint a new killer. 

Plus the fact you can shoot and kill anyone in the game is always nice when you're craving some "GTA like" blood lust. 

Overall, I would recommend this game. I do think the $14.99 is a little high considering the length of the game and the fact that not everyone will want to replay it. I think 9.99 is a more appropriate price. But for ME, I do not regret spending the 15, and therefore I can recommend it to tohers.

35165102.review: Now, I'll be totally honest here: I love this game with all my heart. A few years back I discovered this game online called "Westerado", and I thought that I might as well check it out. I did. And i loved it. I played it for hours. Hours and hours. Even though I wasn't skilled enough to finish it, I played it all the time. I eventually kinda went away from it, seeking other experiences, but I still played it from time to time, and I didn't love it less either. Then, in 2014-15 I found out there was going to be a full feature length game of it on Steam. My world was complete. I pre-ordered the game as soon as I had the money. Then it released. I played it. And I loved it.It was the (very) expanded version of the online game. More areas, characters, endings and choices. Today, I have all the achievments. I still play it. This game is the real thing. Highest replay value ever, fantastic feel and gameplay, so many choices, humor (Maybe a little weird autosave system but I figured it out after a while and it really isn't that bad) and a lot more to look forward to. This is the most underrated game I have ever played. If you're reading this because you are hesitating with buying it, I tell you this: You don't have to wonder anymore. I promise you a good time with this spectacular, unique game. And Ostrich Banditos, if you're reading this, please make another game like this.

35130158.review:
Jednym zdaniem: Westerado to prawdziwa perełka i na pewno najlepsza gra westernowa w historii. Grywalność rodem z klasycznego Sid Meier's Pirates połączona z klimatem Dzikiego Zachodu. Oryginalność łączy się tutaj ze znakomicie przemyślaną rozgrywką i inteligentymi nawiązanianiami do filmowych westernów. A wszystko to podane nam na tacy z lekkim przymrużeniem oka. W skrócie Westerado to naprawdę wyjątkowa gra.

Plusy: 

+ fascynujący westernowy klimat, jakiego do tej pory nie było na PC
+ niezwykle klimatyczna westernowa muzyka (ech... można tego sluchać i słuchać...) 
+ pięknie dopracowany styl graficzny (rozpikselizowanie stanowi tutaj naprawdę zaletę) 
+ wizualna stylizacja na przygody komiksowego Lucky Luke'a)
+  dobra rozgrywka i pomysłowy sposób strzelania (chociaż prosty, to wymagający wprawy)
+ inteligentnie ukryte nawiązania do wielu słynnych westernów (najwięcej nawiązań do spaghetti westernów Serio Leone, ale też do filmów z Johnem Waynem)
+ całkiem fajna fabuła oparta głównie na wątkach z Pewnego razu na Dzikim Zachodzie
+ ważne decyzje jakie podejmujemy w grze (nie da się cofnąć, a mają swoje konsekwencje)
+ wciągająca rozgrywka rodem z lat 80/90 (przygodowe RPG w stylu Sid Meier's Pirates)
+ pięknie wykonane mapa, którą chce się zwiedzać (ta gra to trochę taki sandbox)
+ gra stawia na prawdziwą przygodę bez wielkich podpowiedzi (na zakończenie i mordercę naszej rodziny natkniemy się nawet przypadkowo)
+ wiele świetnych pomysłów (np. ten z kapeluszami jako życiami bardzo oryginalny, poruszanie się po mapie koniami, które mają przystanki w różnych miejscach)
+ zabawne ukryte sekrety (np. ten z reżyserem filmowym, możemy też odkryć plan filmu z dzisiejszych czasów ukryty skrzętnie na mapie) ;)
+ momentami naprawdę zabawne, dobrze napisane dialogi
+ bardzo dobrze napisane postacie NPC oraz interesujące poboczne misje / questy
+ zabawnie zrobione animacje zwierząt z Dzikiego Zachodu
+ świat, który faktycznie reaguje na twoje działania (jak no kogoś zabijesz bez powodu to mieszkańcy Clintville będą do Ciebie wrogo nastawieni i będą strzelać, co utrudnia nam grę)
+ duża losowość w grze (np. za każdym razem ktoś inny jest mordercą)
+ gra jest bardzo nieliniowa (wiele zakończeń i można spokojnie grać kilka razy)

Minusy: : 

- postacie są wizualnie zbyt mało detaliczne (powoduje to problem w rozpoznaniu mordercy, bo jak go tu znaleźć skoro widzimy piksele zamiast twarzy? ;))
- śledzenie questów czasami może być problematyczne

Komu polecam? / Komu odradzam?

+ polecam wszystkim miłośnikom Dzkiego Zachodu, bo to najlepsza gra w tym klimacie na PC
+ polecam fanom westernów Sergio Leone oraz fanom odnajdywania cytatów ukrytych w grze 
+ polecam fanom 6-strzałowych koltów (jeszcze nigdy strzelanie nimi nie było tak fajne)
+ polecam graczom, którzy kiedyś zachwycali się klasycznymi RPG takimi jak Sid Meier's Pirates (Westerado ma właśnie ten klimat szalonej przygody z losowymi wydarzeniami)
+ polecam tym, którzy lubią prawdziwą przygodę i kochają odkrywać ukryte rzeczy i tereny
- odradzam graczom ortodoksyjnie nie lubiącym westernów
- odradzam graczom, którzy lubią być w grze prowadzeni za rączkę od początku do końca
- odradzam przeciwnikom gier z pikselami, bo chociaż ta tutaj jest pięknie wykonana, to może Was jednak razić

Rada 1: 

Zanim zagracie w Westerado, warto żebyście obejrzeli zwłszcza spaghetti westerny Sergio Leone czyli Pewnego razu na Dzikim Zachodzie oraz  trylogię Za garść Dolarów oraz kilka innych klasycznych westernów. Wtedy w pełni docenicie smaczki zawarte w tej grze. )

Rada 2:

Westerado to dla mnie niemałe zaskoczenie - to chyba pierwsza gra od prawie 30 lat, która przypomniała mi przygodę w stylu wielkiego Sid Meier's Pirates. Mówię to serio - ta gra ma właśnie ten klimat i ma w sobie coś fascynującego, co powoduje w graczu żadzę eskploracji, wciągajac nas ukradkiem w świat Dzikiego Zachodu, dokładnie tak samo jak kiedyś Sid Meier wciągał w fascynujący świat piratów z Karaibów.

Pick it up. You won't be disappointed.

Westardo double barreled is a game where you're family is murduerd and you have to find the killler, its gameplay is not very unique but done well,( j to pull out gun, k to load  the gun, k to fire and r to reload) but there is two very unique game mechanics I've never seen before, firstly you can pull your gun out in the middle of any conversation and scecondly the killer is randomly generated and as you play the game (your style) the killer will change the reason he killed your familly. My major problem with the game is that it is £10 (I bought it in the summer sale) which is overpriced I'd say if it was £5 it would be a good cost. Another problem is I got lucky and acidently finished the game in 25 minutes. (because I randomly saw the killer in a town and i chased him down) Another problem is I think the pull out gun at any time is a nice feature but if you do this to a few specific characters you can't do their quest and you need to do their quest to get info on the killer. (I didn't mention this earlier but you get info on the killer so you do side quests most of the time but this is more intersting then other games) 

Now I'l get on to the good the bad and the ugly


  

The good
.Western setting is intersting
.Random killer every time and reason
.It can be anyone
.Each quest feels unique
.Combat is fun
.The conversation options and pull out gun is a very interesting feature 

The bad
.Getting money is too easy (I got $1000 in ten minutes which can buy the shotgun)

The ugly
.I finished it after having to reset the game (Out of seeing the killer in clintville) in 25 minutes 
.It is £10 which is  overpriced

Overall I give it a 8/10 I think it would've been 9 if the price was lower other then that the game is great and your decisions do affect the story.
I'd say if it is under £8 buy it.

Vay canına! Yoksa karamba karambita mı desem? :) Bu oyun beni hiç beklemediğim kadar etkiledi doğrusu. Hakkında hiçbir şey bilmeden, birkaç video izleyip indirimde satın aldım. Ve daha ilk dakikalarından itibaren ekranın başına çakılıp kaldım. 

Westerado'da ailesi bir gece katledilen genç bir sığı çobanını yönetiyoruz. Kahramanımız intikam alabilmek için altıpatlarını kuşanıp başlıyor o çöl senin bu kasaba benim dolaşmaya. Oyunda "Wanted" (Aranıyor) posterlerinden para kazanmaktan tutun da poker oynamaya, posta arabalarına korumalık yapmaktan Kızılderililerle savaşmaya (ya da onların yanında yer almaya) dek her şey var. Yaptıklarınız insanların size olan bakış açısını da değiştiriyor. Önünüze geleni vurursanız kasabalılar sizden kaçıyor, tüm haydutları yakalarsanız en azılı suçlular bile karşınızda tir tir titriyor, Kızılderililerle yardım ederseniz Mavi Ceketliler peşinize takılıyor vs.

Kontroller ilk başta biraz kötü gelse de (sadece sağa veya sola ateş edebiliyorsunuz) bir kez alıştıktan sonra 100 metre öteden birinin şapkasını uçurmak acayip keyif veriyor :) Ailemizi öldüren kişinin sürekli değişmesi, açılan yeni karakterler, yan görevler derken bayağı dolu bir oynanış sunuyor Westerado bizlere. Westerado was one of my favorite games. I played the version on adult swim for about five minutes, and fell in love. Then, a short time later, Westerado: Double Barreled was released. I did not hear about this, somehow. Fast-forward to 2017, and now I've finally been reunited.

Westerado plays like a dream, running perfect 60 fps on even my potato of a computer. It features the ability to kill anyone and anything you want, hunt bounties, herd buffalo, create a truce, murder the director, kill entire towns, become an outlaw, play a game of 5-card, and, of course, seduce a woman. This game is essentially the wild west in a nutshell.

34282258.review:
Westerado is a charming, pixel-nostalgia, western adventure game. I must admit that I found the story and gameplay rather entertaining, and the characters and stories amusing.

My only gripe about this game, and the reason I'm writing a review at all, is to warn future players -- be VERY careful playing this game! Although it's not obvious, this is a game where choices matter. This can be EXTREMELY frustrating sometimes, because simple mistakes can screw up major plot elements.

For example, when I was just figuring out how to move around and shoot stuff, I accidentally fired my gun inside of the town store. So the storekeeper and the assistant started firing back at me. I ultimately prevailed, but alas, they died. And as a result, I was unable to buy any weapons for the entire game! At least I got pretty good with the pistol, but still, this sucks. Such major mistakes should either be made impossible (ie, not allowing the character to shoot in certain places) or undoable. I ran into a number of other cases where people accidentally died (sometimes not even by me!) and this screwed up quests or other storylines. However, this doesn't affect your ability to continue playing the game, which is good.

Oh yeah, and the other thing... the poker AI is ridiculously stupid, which makes earning money quite easy, assuming you know the basics of the game. The secret to winning is: [spoiler]play conservatively until you have a good hand, then bet hard. The computer players never, ever fold. They'll stupidly call any bet regardless of their hand.[/spoiler]

34171726.review: I like this game a lot.  I wouldn't necessarily say it's the best action-rpg I've played(Fallout: New Vegas probably takes that title), but it's wildly entertaining in it's own way.  The nostolgic feeling given off by the simple yet oddly detailed sprites and the top down isometric(I really don't know what the proper term for this type of camera angle is) is fulfilling.  The high yet forgiving difficulty levels give a great sense of adrenaline during shootouts with bandits, and make your victories all the more satisfying.  When you die, the game does a great job of handling the way you respawn, deducting half your cash rather than completely robbing you of all your posessions and progress.  The soundtrack is excellent, further enhancing the rustic western theme.  I personally don't feel like there are enough good wild west games(Call of Juarez is fun though), and this game manages to help fill that gap.  I'd give this a solid 9/10.

34162946.review:
[h1] 《西部世界 双筒猎枪》: 讲述了牛仔杀人事件始末，但这压根不是重点[/h1] 

感谢送我游戏的同好朋友，麦克雷在这儿脱帽致敬！
2017/11/23更新：为彩蛋投了  “一切皆有可能“  奖。

[h1] 8/10的分，够高了。[/h1] 
首先得说，关于推不推荐我犹豫了好久。
但正如个人资料挂的简介，身为21年半的牛仔迷，我选择顶着马赛克和德克萨斯口音，给了推荐。

丑话说在前，画面很二维，那种大像素连文字都难以辨识。还一口一个YEEHAW。
没有汉化，并且文本量很大，但是词汇也不是很生，再不济还有雅虎翻译。

[h1] 剧情 6/10[/h1] 

大概2小时左右的通关流程，全成就也大多是收集或者刷人头，8小时够了
母亲和哥哥被杀，男主投奔叔叔，然后找出真凶。
完了。
牛仔片儿他娘的不需要剧情好吗，我们把重点放在这部200MB小作品其他值得玩味的细节上。
 
[h1] 音乐8/10[/h1] 

作为一个糙人，我也很想荒腔走板地聊聊这个，但就能说“好听”“够味儿”这俩词。苍凉与潇洒是标配，商店页视频的配乐可以先听听看。提到这里就不得不提西部游戏的集大成者大表哥了，挂几首经典配乐，网易云链接。“先把音乐放上，杀人什么的倒可以缓缓”

http://music.163.com/#/m/song?id=5040239&userid=97915495  “DEADMAN’S GUN”
http://music.163.com/#/m/song?id=5040237&userid=97915495  “FAR AWAY”
http://music.163.com/#/m/song?id=5040224&userid=97915495  “DEAD END ALLEY”

以上均为《Red Dead Redemption Original Soundtrack》中收录的原声，见网易云。

再推荐《被解救的姜戈》里一首“WHO DID THAT TO YOU” 昆汀的片子大家懂得。
http://music.163.com/#/m/song?id=26145425&userid=97915495
（ “够味儿到底是啥味道”
   “我也不清楚，差不多是黄沙混着黄油吧” ）

[h1] 画面7/10[/h1] 

马赛克没商量。

[h1] 操作7.5/10[/h1] 

可能刚开始你会觉得，这手感比半藏都玄。
我也是这么觉得的。
但开枪杀几个人就好了。并且比较写实的是每次开枪都要重新扳击锤，相当于K两下，开一枪。细节处理的很棒。
开枪打飞敌人的帽子，把它捡起来，就给自己又续了一命。
如果被乱枪击毙
不要紧
你会一大早在叔叔家的小床上醒来，桌子上铺着二维码一样的桌布。
（也可能是地毯，谁知道呢）
还有就是，没事儿别惹狼群。

[h1] 游戏性9/10[/h1] 

这里指的游戏性泛指一切上文没提到的、好玩儿的、让你大呼值得的设计。
其实是作者真的想把这些梗放在一起讲。（也可能是写一半儿忘了，但作者说他不会承认的）

1.	双人合作模式，受众的确少，但是有基友就不一样了。
2.	开放结局，好像身边的朋友都是致敬星战的结局，所以这个还要靠其他牛仔们去开发。

3.	自由度与线性剧情结合完美，原谅我不得不搬出这么拗口的短语，简而言之就是你真的谁都可以杀，你的叔叔和NPC，还有村庄里的土著，柜台后的小老妹儿。除了叔叔会在你杀了他后，变成幽灵（然后每天在你起床后说早上好）外，其他人都不会复活。
4.	彩蛋无数，我就说一处：当你JKKKKKKKKKKKKKK一顿操作团灭小镇后，你发现一个Director出来跟你说：你太残暴了，连小姑娘都杀，我要为民除害制裁你。然后你被一群杀也杀不完的持枪暴徒围殴。别惊讶，这导演真的杀不死，而且我敢保证你肯定能见到他2333

[h1] 我爱西部片，因为能感受自由、快意恩仇，还有正义和友谊等等。

这小品游戏里也有个大概。[/h1]

I'll say this right off the bat: Westerado is a short game. You will surely blaze through it within an hour or two depending on how confident you are in your Guess Who skills. However, like everyone else said, there are various endings depending on your choices and the appearance of the murderer changes with each subsequent playthrough. 

The story is alright overall, the atmosphere is spot on with the colour palette and the music. Of course, the music will get repetitive... and the scenery will get drab... but for such a short game, it is acceptable. 

I do recommend this game simply because it is a pleasant experience. The fighting mechanic is original and the ability to take out your gun during a conversation in order to pressure the one you're conversing with to "spill the beans" adds another level of immersion.

All in all, give this game a try if you want an evening's-worth of western fun with a few clever jokes here and there.

33810671.review:
Westerado: Double Barreled is a western 2D-shooting RPG game in which you're a guy whose family was murdered for unknown reasons, and it's up to you to track down the killer and find out the reason why he did that.

Pros:
+ Open world - The world is quite big and very explorable; you can go to most of the places in-game and do quests in any order.
+ Clue gathering - To track down the killer, you gotta gather clues by doing quests. These clues are always different for every playthrough/run.
+ Non-replayable quests - Most of the quests don't allow you to retry. So, if you screw up during a quest (e.g. killed an ally, failing the quest), you gotta live with the consequences and move on.
+ Gun mechanics - This keeps the game interesting as you gotta wield your gun, cock and shoot it manually. Protip: don't panic during a shootout or you might accidentally holster your gun instead of shooting.
+ Great music - Nice western music playing in the background! What more could you ask for?
+ Replayability value - The villain and his reason for murdering your family will always be different in each playthrough. Additionally, there are 4 playable characters with distinct aesthetics and traits.
+ Western dialogue - Dialogues are written in western "accent". For some people, this may be good (since the setting is in the Wild West), or... (see Cons)

Cons:
- Journal system - The journal system is pretty good, albeit the quest tracking system on the map. It shows where you need to go to complete quests, but every marker is just an exclamation mark, with no indication which quest it refers to. Protip: Always do quests 1 by 1; never start another quest unless you've finished the previous one. This reduces the amount of exclamation marks on your map.
- Hat types - It seems that all hats are functionally similar despite the prices being different; some are more expensive than the others. This excludes the miner's hat which has a flashlight that makes mine exploring possible.
- Western dialogue - non-English players may find the dialogues somewhat difficult to understand, especially if the sentences are long; you may find yourself skipping dialogues sometimes, which is not very good given the fact that the journal system might be rather confusing.
- 30 FPS lock - Seems like the FPS is locked to 30 and I haven't found a way to raise it to 60. No cancer will be cured.

Others (can be Pro or Con, depending on your perspective):
* No manual saving - The game autosaves everything. So, if you fail a quest, for example, you can't retry it by loading a previous save.
* No post-end game - Despite the game being open world and explorable with many quests, once you reach the ending, you gotta start a fresh game.

Overall:
Westerado: Double Barreled is a very good game with pretty high replayability value. It's definitely recommended for western video game fans. Is it worth the full price? Yes, except you're the kind of player who's satisfied after reaching one ending and doesn't replay the whole game for different ones, or just too lazy to get achievements. When discounted? Just grab it.

33617446.review:
A exploration game which offers several routes and solutions to the quests it provides, with the main objective is to find an accurate description of the criminal. While that description might seem a long game, is actually pretty short letting you replay with different approaches. Combined with unlockable characters, is a game that will last a bit more of a weekend.

While the premise of high replay value with different ways to play the game is already quite solid, seems the game lacks polishing in various aspects. There's friendly fire that either allows you to exploit certain fights against several enemies, or take damage from a NPC assisting you (Don't know if this also happens in co-op). This follows with the scorpions being the real threat of the game, as there might be some cases that can stack several hits if the group together. And obviously due the open nature to play the quests, some of them might become impossible to complete in a blind run.

However, what really bothered me the most is the graphics. Sprite characters are very plain and made of a few pixels, something a lot of indie devs fall into. But the areas look fantastic, and if the characters had a bit more detail the game overall it could've been more appealing to play.

Overall, although some big flaws in my opinion, is a great game to play and beat in a few hours. And since you can beat quests in any order and solution you can experiment further in the next time you wanna go back to it.

33611520.review:
Westerado has quickly become one of my favorite Steam arcade games. 

The trailer for this game basically tells you everything you need to know. You're a wild west gunslinger who lost your family to a violent and terrible murderer. By playing minigames and completing quests for townsfolk, you unlock pieces of the murderer's description. The neat thing is that the murderer IS different every time. Not only that, but the murderer's motivations are different based on how you play the game and how extensively you explored the world.

It's a pretty big world for what the game is. Essentially you have a pair of frontier towns, a Union fort, Indian lands, desert, and an extensive network of underground dungeons. The side quests are all pretty fun in their own right due to a variety in compeletion. Not every quest is a shootout, some are dialouge based, some are travel based, some are item based. It's realy nice how much they've done with such simple mechanics. One of my favorite aspects of Westerado is that it can be completed in anywhere between 5 minutes and 3 hours. There's a ton of stuff to do, but if you just want to capture the murderer you can do that too.

What I really really appreciate is that no matter what quest-line you choose, they all lead to the same road. You learn information about the murderer after completing every quest. This means that every side-quest becomes a main quest in that it furthers your overall goal. That is a masterstroke of story telling and, when paired with achievements not only allows players to explore every single opportunity, but encourages it. 

Combat can be a little confusing at first, but you'll quickly get the hang of it. Every time you start a fight, you have to draw your weapon, cock your pistol, then fire. Though you'll quickly learn how to shoot enemies and avoid the different kinds of gunfire, the game deploys a few side enemies (scorpions, lassoing enemies, Indians, and coyotes) who mix things up just enough to always keep you on your toes. However, what I love most about the combat is that in any conversation you always have the option of raising your gun, cocking your gun, and firing. That's a simple, but neat idea that I'd love to see in more RPGs. 

In addition to the gameplay itself, the pixel art here is absolutley stunning. The bright oranges, the rocks, the birds, the coyotes...everything looks fantastic. Though most of the game is isometric, the developers wisely put in a few side-scrolling vistas to show off what they've done with a pallete of 3 shades of yellow and 2 shades of orange. It's seriously impressive and I'm honestly glad I collected trading cards for Westerado because now I have these wonderful background images.

My one and only caveat is that this game retails for $14.99. I had a lot of fun with it, but I feel this is more of a $5 game. 
Adult Swim Games has really pulled it out with this one. In my opinion, this is their best game since Jazzpunk.

33563241.review: A really fun six-shooter game where no two playthroughs are the same. Find your family's murderer by decent means or by pulling a gun on everyone you come across. It's difficult to get bored during a single playthrough of this game. This can make certain bits of the game rather easy, though some shootouts towards the end can still be challenging. I wouldn't mind a bigger map and more unlockables, but other than that this game is worth the price tag.

33434953.review:
Westerado è un ottimo gioco a tema western in cui viene data piena libertà al giocatore di scegliere cosa fare. L'obiettivo principale è quello di trovare il criminale che ha ucciso la famiglia del protagonista, tuttavia nulla vi vieterà di viaggiare per l'intero mondo di gioco ignorando totalmente la vostra sete di vendetta. Il gioco potenzialmente lo si può finire anche in una decina di minuti, tuttavia il grado di rigiocabilità è molto alto grazie alle molteplici missioni secondarie piene di possibilità di scelta differenti. Inoltre ogni azione compiuta dal giocatore ha un qualche effetto sul mondo di gioco, quindi pensateci bene prima di decidere di mettervi a sparare a qualsiasi cosa respiri.

La pixel art è di ottima fattura sia nei paesaggi e sia nelle animazioni, come anche le musiche, perfettamente in tema western. Il gameplay è semplice ed immediato, di base bisogna solo muoversi e sparare, poi a chi e con cosa spetta al giocatore scegliere. Se vi piacciono i western e avete sempre desiderato fare il cacciatore di taglie oppure intervenire nel conflitto tra indiani e americani, Westerado penso sia un must have. Se invece non vi piace l'ambientazione, dategli comunque una chance, magari durante dei saldi, soprattutto se vi piace quel genere di giochi che offre al giocatore grande libertà di azione.

33432616.review:
[h1] 8ビット系西部劇アクション [/h1] 

農場を襲われ、兄と母を殺された主人公が復讐に立ち上がる話。

襲撃犯は一般人に紛れて町をウロついているので、そいつを捜し出すのがゲームの最終目標となる。
さまざまなクエストをこなしながら、バーターで襲撃犯の情報（黒色の帽子をかぶっている、赤色のバンダナを締めているなど）を集めていくというのが基本的な流れだ。
マップは比較的狭く、2時間もあれば全部回ってお釣りがくる程度。

クエストは駅馬車を襲撃から守ったり、無法者を排除したりといったところ。
マニュアルセーブがないため、イベントの重要な選択肢やクエストの失敗などがそのまま確定してしまうのが気になる。
ちなみに母親に起こされるところから冒険がスタートするとか、死んだら所持金が半分になるとか、某国民的RPGを思わせる要素も。

戦闘は古き良きアーケード調で、これはなかなかに楽しい。
お互い左右にのみ射撃できるため、縦の軸線をズラして敵の攻撃を避け、敵が発砲した隙に飛び込んで射撃。ダッシュで安全地帯に逃げてリロードという感じか。
お金を稼いで武器をアップグレードする要素もあるが、まあ初期装備のままでも一切問題はないだろう。

それなりに面白いが、非常にあっさりと終わるためフルプライスでの購入はあまりオススメできない。
セール時にどうぞ。

This is a very competent adventure game and one of the best looking of the revival of the pixel art games. It also has one of the best soundtracks ever packed into a video game.

With a very basic premise: You're tasked to find revege against the murderer of your family. To achive that you can take a urprising number of alternative ways to find evidence: align with the army or the indians, for once. There are also bandits, an oil tycoon and ranchers, and most of them come with their own colours of side and faction quests.

Although using a keyboard is playable, westerado does play a lot more comfortably with a controller.

On the list of complains, non of them huge, is the quest journal, though functional, feels a lot like a 15 year old RPG, and at points (if you have many quests) can be a chore to peruse. Also you only get 3 save slots, adequate for most players, and I'm positive you can get most alternative endings with this, it still unecessarily limiting.

32953420.review:
Someone's murdered your mother and brother on your family ranch and you set out to find who and why in this pixelated open world RPG lite Western.

Don't let the incredibly simple pixel art fool you. This game is a but load of fun. You can go anywhere in the world right from the get go, talking to people and shooting bandits. Or shooting innocents. Or wild life. And while you're talking to literally anybody you can pull out your gun. You're the star of this Western movie and it's a blast. 

Basically, the main goal of the game is to find the physical description of the bandit who killed your family by helping people out with tasks they need completed. Every quest you complete is another piece of the description. If you're like me, you'll find the description pretty quickly, but it's too much fun to go through the storylines of the many factions peppered throughout the game to stop once you know who the killer is. The writing is also great, filled with fun accents and speech quirks.

Basically, if you love westerns or adventure games, this is a must play. There's a lot of replayability due to its short length and multiple unlockable characters. Highly recommended.

32733293.review:
Westerado is "Way of the Samurai" with a Wild West setting.

This is the rare kind of genre where the game has multiple areas to explore with plenty of things/sidequests to do, but you can't do it all in one playthrough. One playthrough only need about 2-3 hours (there's even an achievement if you can do it in under 1 hour), but the short playthrough is the point of the game as it is meant to be replayed.

In this kind of genre, you pick one main questline, go through it, take some small sidequests along the way, and begin the next playthrough soon after. The point of the game is to do stuff, make mistakes, finish the game, then do it again with different possibilities. For example, if you chose to pick the oil tycoon questline, you can't do the farmer questline because they are in the opposing side of the story. 

Like Way of the Samurai, Westerado gives you a lot of player freedom. It's not just your words that decide where the story goes, but also your action. If someone refuse to answer your request, you can aim your gun to threaten them. Once an NPC fears you, they might not want to talk with you again; but in some other time violence is the only answer, as some questlines are only unlockable when you force your way through.

The combat takes a while to figure out, but once you get the hang of it, it shouldn't be too hard to master. The game allows you to bring partners (through recruitable NPCs and local co-op), but often combat gets too hectic and you can find your friends (or yourself) lie dead from friendly fire.

The game's soundtrack is easily my favorite; pretty memorable and manage to evoke the lone feeling of Wild West.

Unlike Way of the Samurai, though, character customization isn't the greatest in the game. There are four playable characters (three are unlockables) and you can change the color of your outfit, but that's it. Also, unlike Way of the Samurai, some questlines can actually be mix and matched if you talk to the right person in the right time (which can result to oddly hilarious result, like you being a the oil tycoon henchman while at the same time are regarded as a good man by the Indians - whose lands are robbed by the tycoon).

Overall though, this is a pretty enjoyable game. Especially if you like Way of the Samurai. I wish there were more games with this kind of gameplay.

32732593.review:
Westernado : Double Barreled s'adressera à tous les amateurs de Western, de pixel art et d'action-RPG.

On y incarne un cowboy à la recherche du meurtrier de sa famille, un parfait inconnu pour qui il faudra réunir plusieurs indices afin de savoir à quoi il ressemble (son skin change a chaque partie). Ces indices s'obtiendront en aidant différentes personnes de bien des manières : tuer des bandits, protéger un convoi, libérer des bisons, etc... Il y a largement de quoi faire, étant donné qu'il y a bien plus de quêtes que d'indices à récupérer. Le jeu est ainsi potentiellement très court lorsqu'on effectue les quêtes les plus courtes (1 à 2h de jeu), mais rien ne vous empêche d'explorer de fond en comble le vaste monde à la recherche de tous les secrets. Le contenu total est assez conséquent, et il y a aussi trois persos jouables à débloquer (amenant un gameplay différent). De plus, toutes vos actions auront des conséquences irréversibles. Vous pouvez par exemple tuer n'importe quel PNJ, y compris les plus importants, et quand même arriver à vos fins. Au contraire, il est possible de tuer un minimum de gens en choisissant des voies plus diplomatiques. Un aspect rigolo et parfois important est de pouvoir dégainer son arme en plein dialogue, ce qui permet de prendre l'avantage sur un duel ou de débloquer des scénarios.

Côté gameplay, vous commencez avec un simple revolver, et un peu comme dans 12 is better than 6 (en moins chiant puisque tout est sur le même bouton), il vous faudra dégainer, armer et tirer. Avec de l'argent, vous pourrez acheter d'autres armes comme un shotgun ou un fusil. Par contre, il n'est possible de tirer qu'horizontalement, et la hitbox des ennemis (notamment ces saloperies de scorpions) n'est pas toujours très claire. L'ingénieux système de points de vie est représenté par des chapeaux : si vous vous faîtes toucher alors que vous avez un chapeau, vous restez en vie ; mais si vous vous faîtes toucher alors que vous n'avez pas de chapeau, c'est la mort. En visant bien, vous pouvez tirer sur les chapeaux de vos ennemis afin de les récupérer (et d'épargner des vies par la même occasion).

Côté graphique, les décors sont franchements très très beaux, le chara-design est un peu spécial mais clair et efficace. La musique est excellente, et il y a souvent un aspect cinématographique dans les dialogues et la mise en scène, qui est d'ailleurs le sujet d'une petite mise en abîme cachée.

Bref, Westernado : Double Barreled est une excellente pioche, pour peu qu'on aime le pixel art et l'univers du Western, et constitue un vaste terrain de jeu joli et intelligent.

32681724.review: After putting a ton of hours into this game, I realized that it just falls short from being a good game. If you don't mind any of those complaints, then I think you will enjoy it, but that really burned my patience and made the game unenjoyable from just that standpoint alone.

32233750.review:
I recommend this game to almost anyone. 
It's got [b]fantastic art[/b], a very [b]immersive world[/b], and [b]simple, perfected gameplay[/b]. The $15 is a bit pricey, but to anyone on the fence, I highly recommend you try the [url=http://www.a10.com/adventure-games/westerado]original browser version[/url] which is free online. Double Barrelled improves upon the original in scope and depth, but for the most part, the gameplay is the same, and this should give you a good idea of whether to buy this or not.

At $15, the thing holding most people back will be the [b]replayability[/b]. If you enjoyed the original, there is [b]plenty[/b] of replay value here for you. Your actions have huge impacts on the way characters interact with you (even your enemies!), and playing as an outlaw, a hero, or just plain evil, will all lead to different interactions. I found during my first run that I became so infamous that enemies simply stopped enagaging me because they were so terrified of me. Add that to co-op campaign, plenty of secrets, a (secret) survival mode, and a main villian (that you have to find based off of clues and evidence) that's randomly generated every playthrough, there's plenty to justify the price if you enjoy the core gameplay.

32058130.review:
a quaint little western. great pixel graphics, and i liked the soundtrack, despite being a tad repetitive, and limited in variations.

while westerado is tacked as 'open world', it isnt very big, and as such, nor is it a very long game; each playthrough might net you anywhere between 30-40mins, or all the way up to a few hours, depending on what you want to do and achieve. but that being said, there still is plenty to do, if you are so inclined. a good number of quest strings, some of which become inaccessible the moment you pick a certain path. as such, you'll be playing through the game multiple times, just to see where the different quests might lead you.

to spice things up (slightly), you (will, once unlocked) have access to 4 different characters. although they are not all that different in terms of gameplay; just weapon variations, costume, and headgear for the most parts (or lack thereof). 

a combination of different characters, quests, and your path in the game, will lead to a whole slew of endings though, which is another reason for you to play through it over and over again. and despite doing that, you somehow would still have quite a bit of fun.

i only wished that the map was bigger, and there were more random events. but all in all, it's a lot of fun, especially if you like 'open world' action games, with a western motif.

32004802.review:
Westerado: Double Barreled is a fun (But somewhat challenging) 2D shooting game with a very interesting premise and fun mechanics. It has a large replay value (The culprit is someone different each game) and each game is fun. There is a few different playable characters and 4 weapons (Revolver, Dual Revolvers, Shotgun (My favorite), and rifle) each with their own mechanics and traits. The other thing to know about this game is that NO ONE talks... but there are text boxes and there is music. And what music!!! Serious props to the music writers/performers... the music for this game is some of the best "Western Style" music I've ever heard.

I would recommend having a keyboard with a number pad as the default control scheme is a bit to close together (For my tastes) so i set the draw, fire, sprint, and reload to the numbers 4, 5, 1, and 6 respectively.

One of the few bad things about this game is the quest tracking/journal... It's completely broken. You can get by, by you have to write everything down on an actual piece of paper (Or memorize it) to actually know where to go. The only other complaint is that there is no music DLC (I'd buy it in a heartbeat)

I got the game on sale, and I think it's a bit overpriced, but I don't think I would have been to mad/sad if i'd gotten it for full price. 

Verdict: 8.5/10

TL; DR A good game - get it if it's on sale... and at least think about getting it if it's not

31768584.review:
Salut tout le monde déjà avants de commencé merci de lire cette avis, et aussi que ce n'est que le miens tous dépend de vous (même si tous les avis sont quasiment positif)

-Premier point fort du jeu sont ces graphismes : le pixel art et vraiment très jolie, et les animations très simpliste mais sa reste tout de même agréable a regardé. Je tien tous de même à dire que je ne suis pas le genre de personne à dire un jeu "nul" pour sa qualité graphique, mais par contre si il est jolie sa lui rajoute forcément des point, sans que ça soit pour autant utile, mais la comme le jeu et parfait alors il mérite bien une petite partie sur son pixel art excellent.

-Le Game Play : dans l'ensemble c'est vraiment appréciable, j'ai passé 15 heure dessus et me suis pas ennuyer... j'ai fait plusieurs fin et il m'en reste encore qu'elle que une à faire... Car oui ce jeu a plusieurs fin (que je ne citerais pas pour pas gâché le jeu) toujours au même endroit ou avec le même objectif... (Dommage mais on sans lasse pas) mais le méchant qui a tué votre famille lui change.
Quand a l'objectif du jeu il est plutôt simple, faite des quêtes, aidé les gens etc... Et vous débloquerais des informations sur le méchant, en gros pour faire simple et rapide, au début du jeu vous connaissez un seule élément du méchant (souvent le chapeau) mais le chapeau peut être pointus long ou court etc... C’est un peu comme un "qui est ce ?" votre but retrouvé le plus de détaille sur le meurtrier et ce vengé.

-La B.O : vraiment un des point fort du jeu qui m’a le plus marqué, un bon jeu sans bonne musique ce n'est pas logique (en tous cas pour ma part la B.O dans un jeu fait une sacré différence) l'univers western et bien respecté et vous ne serais pas déçus à ce niveau-là.

-Et pour finir la langue du jeu : Un petit point faible de ce côté-là... une traduction peut être à l'avenir serais le bien venus... sinon vous allez passer votre temps avec un dictionnaire Anglais/Français a côté de vous... des plus les personnages parle un argot vraiment Cowboy et sans un minimum de connaissance certain mot seront impossible à traduire...

Voilà en conclusion je recommande fortement ce jeu, des personnages sympathiques ou diaboliques, du "Marshall" au Braqueur de banque, du pistolet au bolas en passant par le fusil de chasse, et surtout de la patience a l'accusation sans justification.
Ce jeu et pour ma par un de mais préférer de ma liste de jeu stem et en Coop c'est encore mieux.

Bref merci pour ce qui on lut jusqu'au bout en espérant vous avoirs aidé pour votre choix mais personnellement il vaut son prix.

31753295.review:
Remember the days of early Fallout. Going around chatting with people, snagging up quests of sorts while wandering aimlessly. Given a lot more freedom than most games (even nowadays)...

Westerado is like that. Albeit not as deep. Not as flexible, and no need to worry about Radscorpions (though watch out for their more "normal" overly aggressive kind).

What is here is a good game. The visuals you'll either love or hate (I loved the graphics in a game called Master of Monsters on the Genesis) and you ultimately have one goal. Find dat dem killer (as a southern boy I signed a contract in the womb stating I can type and speak in such language, it's actually a requirement in the south much like signing up for the draft).

The basic idea is to find the killer ala Clue style. You gather this information by doing quests for people and/or just talking to random people. So when you first start you might now have many details but could get lucky and find the killer (though I believe it's random each time) or spend your time exploring the world and doing quests at your leisure.

Very small assortment of weapons but each plays differently. Espeically the bola which is a fairly easy way to capture bounties alive without risking the hat thing. You can also switch between them, so don't fret.

Oh ya, hat thing. Hats are health. You die when you have no more hats to put on. Good thing is, hats can be picked up from the dirty rotten scoundrels or innocent folk you shoot. Or you could be boring and just buy them.

Quests are varied. Ya you get "go here and shoot x" but you also have side scrolling buffalo guardin rootin and tootin shootin. Bounties, as stated above, normally allow you the option to take a target alive or dead or just one or the other.

They also have a part where you can either follow the armies orders and shoot the injuns or attempt to broker peace with'em.

Also you can rob the bank.

Do it.

Because I said. So ya, snag this if it's on sale because it adds replay value by providing many different characters. I beat this in 3 hours, though I could have done it quicker. I also missed out on a few quests though and didn't play any of the other unlocked characters.

Lastly, talk to the chiefs brother 4 times for a special gift! I promise it isn't a scalpin. 

TL;DR

Hats. Rob Banks. Shoot Uncle, inf act just shoot everyone you see= Big Thumbs Up (BTU I tell you what...).
